title: The STAR time projection chamber: a unique tool for studying high multiplicity events at RHIC
journal: Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research Section A: Accelerators, Spectrometers, Detectors and Associated Equipment
Nucl. Instrum. Methods Phys. Res., Sect. A
note: The Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider Project: RHIC and its Detectors
keywords: Detectors TPC, Time projection chambers, Drift chamber, Heavy ions
abstract: The STAR Time Projection Chamber (TPC) is used to record the collisions at the Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider. The TPC is the central element in a suite of detectors that surrounds the interaction vertex. The TPC provides complete coverage around the beam-line, and provides complete tracking for charged particles within Â±1.8 units of pseudo-rapidity of the center-of-mass frame. Charged particles with momenta greater than 100MeV/c are recorded. Multiplicities in excess of 3000 tracks per event are routinely reconstructed in the software. The TPC measures 4m in diameter by 4.2m long, making it the largest TPC in the world.
